cleaned_text: Clear Now': A Local COVID Vaccination Update with AHB Director Vicky Kistler | WDIY Local News Pennsylvania has delivered over 16 million total COVID-19 vaccinations so far, and health experts have emphasized how getting the vaccine is critical in the fight against the pandemic. WDIY's Sarit Laschinsky speaks with Vicky Kistler, Director of the [Allentown Health Bureau](https://www.allentownpa.gov/Health-Bureau) about how local efforts to immunize the community have been proceeding, the need to get vaccinated against COVID-19 and its variants, and why people who previously contracted COVID still need to get the jab. The health bureau has free, walk-in, no-appointment vaccine clinics Monday-Friday from 9 AM to 3:30 PM, at 245 N. Sixth St., Allentown. First and second shots, boosters, pediatric shots and flu shots are available. People can also call 610-437-7760, and choose 0 to schedule an appointment outside those hours, or to be referred to another clinic.
